alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 22 at 3:36PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dale, southeastern Coffee, Geneva and western Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, Jackson, northeastern Bay, northern Calhoun, eastern Walton and Holmes Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, northwestern Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida and Washington Counties in the Panhandle of Florida through 530 PM EDT/430 PM CDT/... At 436 PM EDT/336 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Daleville to near Bonifay to 19 miles west of Blountstown. Movement was west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Cottonwood, Vernon, Bonifay, Geneva, Marianna, Dothan, Fort Rucker, Ozark, Blountstown, Enterprise, Chipley, Graceville, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Level Plains, Slocomb, Newton and New Brockton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
